greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest multiple of n with digit sum = 2, or 0 if no such number exists, e.g. a(3k)=0.
example: a(7) =a(13) = 1001. digit sum of 1001 = 2 and is the smallest such multiple of 7 and 13. a(17) = 100000001= 17*5882353.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 01 2002
